;秦刚神秘缺席一个月后突然被撤职，离开了人们中国的人们对这位前外交部长失宠背后的原因感到困惑和猜测。

;

;无论是网上还是网下，许多中国人都发现有关秦——现在是中国有史以来任期最短的外交部长——的官方信息缺乏关于秦的详细信息。是什么可能导致了一位曾经冉冉升起的新星命运的突然转变。

;

;自 6 月 25 日以来，秦就没有在公开场合露面，除了未具体说明的“健康原因”之外，没有提供任何官方解释，直到周二官方媒体据报道，他已被解除职务。但许多中国用户仍然不相信健康会发挥作用。

;

;虽然审查制度显然在限制有关秦的社交媒体帖子，但许多中国社交媒体用户仍然能够讨论他的被删除并公开讨论猜测是什么原因导致他的前任、共产党外交部长王毅再次被任命为外交部长。

;

;许多评论猜测秦离开的可能原因，从私人事务到严重的政治问题不当行为，在微博（中国类似推特的平台）上未经审查。

;

;“如果他确实病了，我认为人们应该知道。一张照片就可以完成这项工作。现在谣言满天飞，只有傻子才会相信（他生病了）”，一位名叫刘雨辰的微博用户说道。

;

;“只要说实话，天就不会塌下来。” ”

;

;刘指的是外交部 7 月 11 日的简短声明，称秦因“健康原因”将缺席本周的东盟会议，由高级外交官王接替他的职务。

;

;迄今为止，北京方面对秦缺席公共生活的唯一解释没有提供任何细节。

;

;中国最高立法机构全国人民代表大会常务委员会于周二宣布了秦的离职。该委员会将这一职位交给了他的前任王——几个月前刚刚晋升为政治局委员，级别比秦高一级。

;

;但是，该委员会没有对秦的免职做出任何解释，57其级别中最年轻的官员。不过，到目前为止，他仍然保留了国务委员的职位，这仍然使他的地位高于其他部长。

;

;另一位微博用户表示，他们发现健康角度“缺乏说服力”，因为众所周知，北京进行非常严格的筛查其官员的行为和任何健康问题不应令人意外。

;

;更令人困惑的是，在秦被免职后，提及秦的内容和有关他工作的报道都从外交部网站上删除了。

;< p>;但截至周三，有关他的报道仍然可以在国务院网站上找到，民族主义小报《环球时报》在另一个中国社交网络小红书上发布的秦的采访和访问视频片段也是如此。

;

;一间办公室一位驻北京的工作人员也对官方有关秦健康状况的说法表示怀疑。

;

;“我不相信他生病了，因为国家安排的这些高级官员如果出现任何问题，都会很早就被发现。”与其他接受采访的人一样，由于公开谈论中国政治的敏感问题，要求匿名。

;

;“我认为这不正常，”该员工说。说。 “重新任命王毅给人的印象是，他是最后的选择，其他人都不足以胜任这一职位。”

;

;中国用王毅取代秦刚，但大问题依然存在

;< p>;一位在广告业工作的20多岁的上海居民也不认为健康状况不佳是秦长期缺席并最终被解雇的原因。

;

;“这是他们通常在外面说的，为了留住人们”她说，指的是国家。

;

;广东省一家国际公司的一位法律顾问强调了秦国崛起的惊人速度和”他的垮台。

;

;“他像火箭一样升上权力，又像流星一样离开，”顾问说。

;

;“但这些与政府官员有关的问题一直是不透明的，这给谣言和阴谋论留下了很大的空间。这不利于政府建立信任。”

;

;对于一些观察家来说，缺乏细节并不奇怪。

;

;“中国外交部长失踪的整个事件让外部观察家感到惊讶，这是可以理解的中国媒体项目独立研究计划主任戴维·班志远 (David Bandurski) 表示：“这提醒我们，今天的中国政治一如既往地运作着。”一些微博用户还猜测秦的下台是否意味着中国外交政策路线的改变，或者是前外交部发言人赵立坚的回归，他的风格好斗秦上任一周后，赵被调到外交部边界与海洋事务司。他周二在微博上表示，秦在如此短的任期后被免职令人惊讶。

;

;香港浸会大学副教授露秋露薇表示，有关秦被免职的帖子没有得到全面审查的原因是可能是缺乏关于如何控制舆论的明确指示。

;

;“我认为社交媒体平台还没有收到高层的指示，”这位前凤凰卫视记者表示。

;

;“我认为社交媒体平台还没有收到高层的指示。” >;

;相比之下，搜索词“彭帅”很快就被审查了，并且在微博上仍然受到审查，路秋说，他指的是在一条现已删除的微博帖子中指控前副总理张高丽性侵犯的中国网球运动员

;

;因此，互联网上关于秦命运的讨论并不表明国家审查机构缺乏迅速采取行动的能力，她说。

;

;“为什么对小红书和好像比微博上更严格？我相信这就是各个平台的风险评估。”

;

;麦俊补充报道

;阿里巴巴集团控股公司的云计算服务部门扩大了在中国对下一代技术的支持大语言模型 (LLM) – 用于训练 ChatGPT 等聊天机器人的技术 – 由 Meta Platforms 于上周推出，作为用于研究和商业用途的免费人工智能 (AI) 资源。

;

;阿里云，中国电子商务巨头的数字技术和智能骨干，已将 Meta 的 Llama 2 LLM 添加到其开源“模型即服务”平台 ModelScope，该平台提供 700 多个人工智能模型，涵盖从计算机视觉到计算机视觉等各个领域。自然语言处理和音频 - 面向本地开发人员。阿里巴巴旗下拥有《南华早报》。

;

;将 Llama 2 添加到其 ModelScope 平台符合阿里云为 LLM 初创企业提供“包括模型训练、推理和部署在内的综合服务”的目标。这家总部位于杭州的公司周二在其官方微信账户上发布的一篇文章中表示。此外，该公司表示将为这些企业提供资金和其他形式的支持。

;

;法学硕士是深度学习人工智能算法，可以使用非常大的数据集识别、总结、翻译、预测和生成内容

;

;阿里云还在其帖子中表示，它通过 ModelScope 定制了服务，使使用 Llama 2 的中国开发者能够更快地设计和构建人工智能应用程序。

;

;该公司已扩大规模ModelScope 上的法学硕士项目反映了中国科技行业对通过构建类似 ChatGPT 的创新服务缩小与西方差距的强烈兴趣，因为政府着手实施法学硕士国家标准以配合监管人工智能的努力。

;

;根据 7 月 19 日宣布的与微软公司的合作伙伴关系，Facebook 母公司 Meta 表示，这家软件巨头是其“Llama 2 的首选合作伙伴”，Llama 2 经过优化，可在 Windows 上本地运行，并可在 Azure 云计算平台上使用。据称，Llama 2 还可以通过亚马逊网络服务 (AWS) 和其他云提供商获得。

;

;阿里巴巴、微软、AWS 和其他提供商的云计算服务使企业能够购买、销售、租赁或分销一系列产品。软件和其他数字资源作为互联网上的按需服务，就像来自电网的电力一样。这些资源在数据中心内进行管理。

;

;随着 Llama 2 免费用于研究和商业用途，Meta 为开发人员提供了市场上昂贵的 LLM 的替代方案，例如 ChatGPT 创建者 OpenAI 的 GPT-4 和 GPT- 3.5.

;

;不过，基于 Llama 2 构建的每月活跃用户超过 7 亿的人工智能服务将需要向 Meta 寻求许可。

;

;百度、阿里巴巴、腾讯控股和华为技术有限公司今年早些时候推出了各自的法学硕士申请，以便在中国各行业得到更广泛的采用。

;一名前香港公务员因藐视法庭罪被判缓刑他扰乱了与 2019 年反政府抗议和国家安全法有关的法律程序。

;

;前贸易官员苏日偕 (Walter So Yat-kai) 周三承认，他在向法官提出质疑时干扰了法院的运作” 在 2021 年 12 月的四次开庭中就不可接受的着装作出裁决。

;

;高等法院获悉，这名有精神疾病史的 53 岁男子在两次开庭时被告知脱下衣服后造成骚乱。黑色连帽衫上印有黄色雨伞图案，这是源自 2014 年占领运动的抗议标志。

;

;当他被要求确认自己是否符合医学资格时，他曾两次与法官发生争执

;

;法官陈健强因苏出身良好、患有精神疾病及重犯机会较低，判处他入狱两个月，缓刑两年。

;

;但他强调，干扰司法行政的情况非常严重，通常会立即被判处监禁。

;

;不过，陈表示，他同意曾从事贸易工作的苏的说法。涉及政府的工业、技术和创新事务，是一个罕见的值得宽大处理的案件。

;

;法院下令苏支付律政司司长在该案中收取的费用 310,955 港元（39,805 美元）。藐视法庭诉讼，其中包括 104,620 港元，用于支付该案聘请私人律师的费用。

;

;原告人的书面陈述将苏视为“静坐专家”——定期出席法庭开庭的人，这表明他支持那些因参与 2019 年骚乱或北京实施的国家安全法而受到指控和处罚的人。

;

;要求香港法院禁止抗议歌曲将产生“寒蝉效应”：专家

;

;律政司司长何卓珩辩称，前政府工作人员的行为破坏了法律程序的严肃性，并浪费了法庭时间。

;

;他强调了苏先生如此激动的一个例子他决定禁止他穿黄色雨伞连帽衫，他指着法官，要求他做出解释，并在用相当大的力量打开法庭门时意外撞到了一名保安。

;

;“看看这四个人事件作为一个集体和客观的整体......被告在法庭上坚持穿着带有政治信息的不恰当服装，尽管法院有相反的指示，”何说。

;

;“可以做出的合理推断......是被告故意试图‘测试法庭或主审法官的极限’。”

;

;陈同意何对案件严重性的评估，并强调政治符号“在法庭上没有地位”。

;

;香港法官因恶作剧呼叫法官而判处 19 岁男子缓刑

;

;被告在法庭上就其头饰进行争论，尽管他有医学证据表明应该例外陈说，这是不可接受的，反映了他阻碍诉讼程序的意图。

;

;但他补充说，他发现了“强有力的减刑因素”，例如苏经常抑郁，并因参与一项活动而受到纪律处分。无关的刑事案件。

;

;陈说，苏也有皮肤病，近年来病情恶化，使他对自己的病情被其他人注意到很敏感。

;

;“鉴于情况法官裁定，被告人被禁止并与生活失去平衡，并且患有日益严重的抑郁症，他很容易表现出不符合性格的行为。

;

;国家警察局逮捕的六人中也是如此。安全警察因在法庭听证会上涉嫌煽动行为而被逮捕。

;

;他在没有受到指控的情况下被警方保释，但去年另外两人被定罪并入狱。

;国家开展专门针对本地数据造假的统计检查，此举试图确保备受关注的第五次全国经济普查已经展开，国家统计局周二宣布，将从下旬开始开展今年首次数据专项检查。 7月，覆盖河北、黑龙江、河南、湖南、贵州、陕西等省份。

;

;“统计专项检查作为统计监督的重要‘武器’，……坚决防范和惩治数据造假、违法违规行为。”国家统计局表示：“这是不断增强统计工作的科学性、权威性和统计数据真实性、准确性的重要制度安排。”

;

;中国统计局经济普查发现更多虚假数据

;

;国家统计局补充说，截至周二，国家统计局检查组已进驻三个省份，检查将持续约13天。

;

;检查组将声明称，开展约谈、审查公众举报、研究相关文件并开展执法检查。

;

;北京长期以来一直承诺提高经济数据质量，以更好地协助决策尤其是在疫情后的经济复苏似乎正在失去动力的情况下。

;

;地方政府被认为最有动力夸大数字，官员们普遍认为他们的职业前景与经济密切相关。

;

;“复苏每况愈下”：中国经济数据的6大要点

;

;2021年，国家统计局披露了地方政府经济数据造假案件，此前两起事件年检中，有官员指使企业伪造数据。

;

;还有人提供虚假统计表，让企业“跟风”，确保“稳增长”。

;

;涉及山东省电动汽车制造商Levdeo的欺诈案，该公司创始人李国新一月份表示，潍坊市县级官员强迫该公司将工业产值和销售额夸大至67亿元人民币（9.39亿美元）与实际销售额20亿元相比。

;

;潍坊市政府周二发布通知称，经调查发现，Levdeo虚报统计数据，县级官员干扰报告数据。九名相关地方官员受到处分。

;

;中国于6月启动第五次全国经济普查，第二、三产业普查将持续至12月。

;

;经济普查上一次人口普查是在 2018 年进行的，它将深入了解三年来冠状病毒大流行的影响。

;

;共产党的喉舌《人民日报》周三发表了一篇评论文章，题为“确保真实性”

;

;各有关部门要落实“数据质量第一的原则”。

;

;“要严格审核，确保数据质量。文章称，各级普查机构要加强全过程质量控制……确保普查数据真实准确。

;

;“要组织事后质量检查，加强普查执法检查，坚决抵制普查数据造假，坚决抵制各种干扰普查数据的行为。”

; Wed, 26 Jul 2023 20:50:01 +0800 Elderly Hongkongers to get health checks while receiving free food from community workers in new programmehttps://www.scmp.com/news/hong-kong/society/article/3229030/elderly-hongkongers-get-health-checks-while-receiving-free-food-community-workers-new-programme?utm_source=rss_feed

;香港理工大学与食品分发慈善机构将开展为期两年的社区健康活动由李嘉诚基金会资助的针对老年居民的监测计划。

;

;博慈善基金会运营的大学和美食天使周三宣布，他们将培训 40 名社区工作人员，以测量居民的不同健康指标.

;

;工作人员在为深水埗100名长者送餐时，会记录他们的生命体征，如血氧、血压、脉搏、疼痛指数等。计划负责人、理大护理学院助理教授黄君正博士表示，他们会将数据上传至网上平台，供护士分析以采取跟进行动。

;

;计划负责人、理大护理学院助理教授黄君正博士表示这是香港首创。

;

;“我们希望迈出第一步，让政府看到我们在做什么，”他说。

;

;基金会向香港捐赠1115万美元（140万美元）为该计划提供资金。

;

;“这种伙伴关系展示了‘和’的力量，这意味着老年人不仅可以获得免费食物，还可以获得医疗支持，”Li ，95，说。 “另一方面，身为惜食堂社区工作人员和免费食物受益者的家庭主妇，成为服务的给予者和接受者。”

;

;香港的“隐性老人”：一连串的悲剧是否可以避免？< /h3>;

;惜食天使是深水埗免费膳食的主要供应商之一，自2014年起已为约700个低收入家庭和近千名长者提供服务，不少社区工作者也是受益者。

;

;电子平台将存储老年参与者的医疗记录，并自动提醒他们服药和预约。

;

;社区工作人员将于9月开始培训，同时电子平台正在建设中发达。工作人员将于 2024 年开始监控参与者。

;

;香港必须重新获得竞争力，帮助贫困老年人：李约翰

;

;但黄表示，电子平台无法访问存储在政府数据库，护士必须手动导入参与者的记录。政府的电子医疗系统存储患者的信息，但只有医生可以访问这些信息。

;

;“作为护士，我们无权访问电子医疗系统中的数据，因此我们无法连接[我们的系统和电子医疗] ，”他说。

;

;丑闻缠身的新加坡执政党并不监管议员的私生活，并且该党第二号领导人周三表示，从未对婚外情采取零容忍态度。

;副总理黄循财在接受 BBC 采访时表示，人民行动党 (PAP) 拥有独特的政策关于刑事不法行为（这是不可接受的）和其他形式的不当行为。

;“[对于]腐败和刑事不法行为，我们采取零容忍态度，”黄在自执政以来首次接受党领导人的重要采访中说道。一连串的丑闻让长期占据主导地位的政党在本月陷入困境。

;对于“人性弱点”的问题，执政党“非常有认识”。 of the impact that our actions have on innocent parties, including families, especially the spouses and their children”, Wong said, adding that it still set high standards for propriety and personal conduct.

;

;“We have to find the right balance between exercising compassion and sensitivity, while upholding the fundamental requirement of our responsibilities and trust with Singaporeans,” he said.

;

;Asked by the BBC's Mariko Oi on perceptions that Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong had kept the affair between Tan and Cheng “hidden as a secret” despite first learning about it in 2020, Wong said the party did not “police the private lives of all MPs”.

;

;Wong said Lee would go through the timelines again next week, when he is expected to address parliament on the matter.

;Wong, who last year was named the PAP's next leader – effectively making him the next prime minister – declined to answer if he would have acted differently if the scandal had unfolded under his watch, saying “these are hypothetical situations”.

;

;Some local commentators have suggested the leeway Prime Minister Lee gave Tan and Cheng over their indiscretions was a stark departure from a decades-old party ethos that leaders ought to be not just incorruptible, but of unimpeachable character and integrity.

;“Eventually, if I do have a chance to take over – if I do – I know that it is not just about me taking over because I also have to earn that trust with Singaporeans myself,” Wong said.

;Argentina will open a consulate in Chengdu, the capital of Sichuan province, as part of efforts to boost bilateral ties and meet the “growing demands” of its citizens in that part of China.

;

;The new consulate – Argentina's fourth mission in mainland China – will have jurisdiction over the province of Shaanxi in the northwest, Sichuan, Yunnan and the city of Chongqing in the southwest, and Guizhou province in the south, the embassy said in a post on WeChat on Monday.

;

;The announcement came after Argentinian President Alberto Fernández on Thursday signed a presidential decree calling for a reshuffle of the South American nation's consular offices in China as the bilateral relationship deepens and to meet the “growing demands of compatriots”.

;

;“It is considered necessary to order the opening and reorganisation of the constituencies of certain consular offices in [China], with the purpose of also allowing a greater diffusion of the image of [Argentina], as well as providing new currents of commercial and cultural exchange,” the decree said.

;

;Argentina also has consulates in Shanghai and Guangzhou, and an embassy in Beijing.

;

;It comes as Buenos Aires and Beijing are seeking closer ties. They upgraded the relationship to become “comprehensive strategic partners” in 2014 after establishing diplomatic relations in 1972.

;

;China is Argentina's second largest trading partner after Brazil, and one of the main destinations for its agricultural exports.

;

;Argentina's economy has been struggling for years, with inflation at over 100 per cent, a weak peso and a lack of foreign currency reserves. It started paying for Chinese imports in yuan, instead of US dollars, in April and the two countries in June agreed to double the currency swap line to 70 billion yuan (US$9.8 billion).

;

;In Argentina, US dollars are so scarce that yuan use is at record high

;

;Last month, China backed Argentina's claims to the Falklands, the disputed British islands near South America that Argentina calls the Malvinas. Geng Shuang, China's deputy permanent representative to the United Nations, said the issue was “a historical legacy of colonialism”.

;“Although the colonial era has passed, hegemonism and power politics that are in line with colonial thinking still exist today,” he said. ;

;The new Argentinian mission in Chengdu comes after Turkey opened a consulate in the city in June, the first Middle Eastern nation to have a diplomatic presence there.

;;2023.07.26 19:35;
;;

;With the help of Chinese scientists, Thailand debuted its first tokamak device – a machine designed to replicate the sun's nuclear fusion process – in a milestone for sustainable energy research and scientific cooperation between the countries.

;

;The Thailand Tokamak-1, which started operating on Tuesday, is a joint effort between the Thailand Institute of Nuclear Technology and the Chinese Academy of Sciences' Institute of Plasma Physics in the southeastern city of Hefei.

;

;The device is the first tokamak for a member of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations. Thailand is expected to design and build its own tokamak for domestic use in the next decade, with an aim to become Southeast Asia's hub for fusion technology development, according to the Thai Public Broadcasting Service.

;

;Thai and Chinese researchers team up on frontiers of science

;

;The device is a “fruitful result” of nuclear fusion cooperation between China and Thailand in recent years, said the state-run China News Service, adding that the Institute of Plasma Physics would continue cooperation with its counterparts in Thailand.

;

;Fusion energy is considered the “ultimate energy” for a carbon-neutral future because the process of creating it does not emit greenhouse gases or nuclear radioactive waste. Its major by-product is helium, an inert, non-toxic gas.

;

;Scientists have conducted research on fusion for decades with the aim of finding a sustainable and cost-effective way to meet the world's energy demands. They want to build fusion devices that mimic the fusion reaction of the sun and other stars.

;

;In the fusion reaction that powers the sun, hydrogen nuclei collide and fuse into heavier helium atoms, releasing tremendous amounts of energy during the process.

;

;Fusion reactions take place in a state of matter called plasma – a hot, charged gas – at temperatures of around 10 million degrees Celsius, according to the International Atomic Energy Agency.

;

;China is at the forefront of nuclear fusion research. Its “artificial sun” – the Experimental Advanced Superconducting Tokamak (EAST) in Hefei – set a world record in April by running for 403 seconds in a “high-constraint mode” plasma operation, breaking its previous record of 101 seconds set in May 2021.

;

;The Thailand Tokamak-1 was upgraded from the HT-6M, a tokamak device developed by the Institute of Plasma Physics in 1984. The device was officially decommissioned in 2002 after 18 years of operation, according to the institute.

;

;In 2017, the Institute of Plasma Physics signed a cooperation agreement with the Thailand Institute of Nuclear Technology and announced it would donate the tokamak to Thailand.

;

;The Chinese institute said it would help Thailand install and operate the facility and cultivate talent in the field of fusion energy research and development.

;

;“After signing the agreement with Thailand, the Institute of Plasma Physics has fully upgraded the HT-6M device and its subsystems, which has substantially improved the device's performance,” the institute said on its website.

;

;Chinese donation fuels Thailand's fusion energy research

;

;The tokamak device passed a completion inspection and was delivered to the Thailand Institute of Nuclear Technology in December 2022.

;

;“The whole facility is composed of 462 major parts, weighing over 84 tonnes (93 tons). They will be shipped to Thailand in six containers,” Huang Yiyun, a key member of the project, was quoted as saying by state news agency Xinhua in November 2022.

;

;About 60 Chinese technicians were sent to Thailand to help assemble, adjust and test the machine before the official launch, it added.

;

;Previously, a group of nine scientists from Thailand came to Hefei for a three-month training programme to learn how to operate the tokamak.

;

;The first successful test of the device happened on April 21, according to Nopporn Poolyarat, head of the Thailand Institute of Nuclear Technology's nuclear fusion and plasma division, speaking to the Post in May.

;

;“On that morning we still had some problems to fix. Later in the afternoon, we tried again and suddenly we got the first breakdown,” he said, referring to a transition from gas to plasma.

;

;“Everyone was happy. Even though it was a small breakdown, at least we saw plasma.”

;Hong Kong police have rounded up six men after a crackdown on a crime syndicate behind the laundering of HK$175 million (US$22.4 million) of suspected illicit cash in just seven months, the force said on Wednesday.

;

;Police said five of the six were among the holders of 33 bank accounts that were used by the syndicate to launder illegal funds between May and November 2022.

;

;“An investigation revealed that the six men were paid between hundreds of dollars and HK$1,000 to set up each bank account,” Senior Inspector Ng Kwan-lam of the force's financial intelligence and investigation bureau said.

;

;“But they had to hand over the account details, such as passwords, and bank cards to the syndicate.”

;

;He said the sixth suspect – a 34-year-old man – was an alleged core member of the syndicate, who is accused of using the bank accounts to collect money from the victims of phone and online scams and launder the cash.

;

;The investigation showed more than HK$28 million of the illegal funds was generated by three online investment scams and 24 phone frauds, Ng said.

;

;He added victims of the 27 scams lost a total of HK$113 million and HK$28 million of the scammed money was laundered through the bank accounts controlled by the syndicate.

;

;The biggest loser was an 81-year-old retired man who was conned out of HK$15 million in a phone fraud in mid-2022.

;

;Hong Kong student among 6 arrested as police clamp down on money laundering group

;

;Police said the man got a call from someone who claimed to be an officer from the mainland China public security bureau. The victim was accused of involvement in money laundering on the mainland.

;

;“The victim was asked to provide his bank account details and password for investigation purposes,” Ng said.

;

;The elderly man realised it was a scam when he found HK$15 million had been looted from his bank account in 43 transactions between June and July last year.

;

;But police were able to identify those involved in the scam.

;

;Officers arrested six city men aged from 23 to 36 in a series of raids across the city in an operation, code-named “Greythunder”, on Tuesday.

;

;Police said the suspects were detained on suspicion of money laundering and conspiracy to launder crime proceeds. They were still in police custody on Wednesday.

;

;Hong Kong police intercepted more than HK$11 billion in scam money over 6 years

;

;The force said the investigation continued and further arrests were not ruled out.

;

;Ng added officers were also investigating the flow and final destinations for the illegal funds.

;

;He appealed to the public not to lend or sell their bank accounts to others for handling money from unknown sources and warned that people who did could be prosecuted for money laundering.

;

;Money laundering is punishable by up to 14 years in jail and a HK$5 million fine in Hong Kong.

;

;Officers from the Anti-Deception Coordination Centre, responsible for tracking scammed cash, have prevented more than HK$11 billion from reaching the hands of criminals since it was set up about six years ago.
